DOC.brief_summary: Hand osteoarthritis ( HOA ) affect interphalangeal joint metacarpophalangeal thumb common disease , prevalence 30 % population 70 . Some form HOA refractory usual treatment ( analgesic , NSAIDs , local injection ) lead high disability . In vitro vivo study show IL-6 involved OA process . The aim present study assess efficacy Interleukin-6-Receptor Inhibitor ( tocilizumab ) pain function patient refractory hand OA .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Interleukin-6 Receptor Antagonist Tocilizumab Patients With Hand Osteoarthritis
DOC.detailed_description: Inclusion criterion : age 40 85 year ; HOA accord ACR criterion ; pain intensity least 40 ( VAS 0-100 ) ; least 3 painful joint within previous 3 month ; least 3 OA joint ( KL grade â‰¥ 2 ) ; failure respond full dose analgesic and/or NSAID . Exclusion criterion : history active inflammatory disease involve hand ; previous treatment TNF inhibitor ; history active chronic infection ; latent active tuberculosis . Patient randomize receive investigational product placebo week 0 week 4 ( 1:1 ) - arm 1 : 2 infusion four week apart tocilizumab 8mg/kg - arm 2 : 2 infusion four week apart saline solution Follow-up visit organize week 6 , week 8 week 12 . Primary outcome pain assess VAS week 6 . Secondary outcome include morning stiffness duration , patient practitioner global assessment , functional index hand OA , number painful joint , number swollen joint . 90 patient expect randomized 18 month . Each patient sign informed consent begin study .
